newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-BHP says in talks over Dai Hung oil.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-BHP says in talks over Dai Hung oil.

text.p: The Broken Hill Pty Co Ltd (BHP) said on Friday it was continuing talks with Malaysia's Petroliam Nasional Bhd (Petronas) and the Vietnamese government over its future role in the Dai Hung offshore oil project.
"I would hope there will be a resolution to that in this quarter," BHP's managing director John Prescott told reporters.
BHP is operator of the Dai Hung field, once thought to be one of Asia's largest, and has a 43.75 percent stake in it.
Other members of the Dai Hung consortium are Petronas with a 20 percent stake, the Vietnam government's PetoVietnam with 15 percent and Total Sa and Sumitomo Corp with 10.625 percent each.
Asked to comment on a reported desire on the part of Petronas to take over operation of the project, Prescott said: "We're certainly happy to be talking to them."
BHP previously fully wrote down its A$151 million investment in Dai Hung in its 1995/96 (June-May) accounts.
According to initial estimates, Dai Hung had recoverable oil reserves of 700 million barrels, but this was later revised down to 100 million barrels.
